column4: Ok, a question about distupgrades then. You trigger this with "apt-get distupgrade", right? Is this as good as installing the latest ubuntu from scratch, or are there any benefits in installing the latest version from scratch?
How do I find out, which version of Ubuntu I run?

No one answered, so I try again: Is updating from one version of ubuntu to another as good as installing the latest ubuntu from scratch, or are there any benefits in installing the latest version from scratch?
Clean install sounds nice though. Personally I found upgrading from 8.04 to 8.10...Hell.
